Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Actor
  • abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    An Actor object is an object which can move around on the screen using Turtle Graphics. The class is abstract so it is not possible to instantiate it directly. Instead the Turtle class can be instantiated.
    Version:
    2017-01-05
    Author:
    (Nikolaj Ignatieff Schwartzbach) .

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Actor​(int x, int y, double theta)
      Creates a new Actor object in a Canvas, at a position (x,y) with angle theta (radians).

      Adds this Actor to the Canvas.
      double getAngle()
      Returns the angle that this Actor is facing (in degrees).

      Returns the Canvas.
      int getColor()
      Returns the current color of this Actor (as an integer to be used in setColor()).

      Returns the current Color object of this Actor.
      double getX()
      Returns the x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.
      double getY()
      Returns the y-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.
      boolean isPenDown()
      Checks whether or not this Actor is currently drawing.

      Moves this Actor a specified number of units in the direction it is facing.
      void moveTo​(double newX, double newY)
      Moves this Actor to a specified position.
      void pause()
      This method pauses the current thread for a short duration of time (100ms).
      void pause​(long milliseconds)
      This method pauses the current thread for a specified duration of time.
      void penDown()
      Instructs this Actor to start drawing.
      void penUp()
      Instructs this Actor to stop drawing.
      void setColor​(int i)
      Sets the color to c, 0 <= c < 6 0: black, 1: red, 2: blue, 3: yellow, 4: green, 5: magenta Will set the color to Black if an integer outside the interval [0, 5] is chosen.
      void setColor​(java.lang.String col)
      Sets the color to the specified color.
      void turn​(double degrees)
      Instructs this Actor to rotate a specified number of degrees (clockwise).
      void turnTo​(double degrees)
      Sets the rotation of this Actor to a specified number of degrees.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor​(int x,
             int y,
             double theta)
        Creates a new Actor object in a Canvas, at a position (x,y) with angle theta (radians).
        Parameters:
        w - The Canvas object to add this Actor to.
        x - The x-coordinate of this Actor.
        y - The y-coordinate of this Actor.
        theta - The angle (in radians) of this Actor.

    • Method Detail

      • isPenDown

        public boolean isPenDown()
        Checks whether or not this Actor is currently drawing.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing whether or not this Actor is currently drawing.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor. Will not necessarily be an integer-value.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the y-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor. Will not necessarily be an integer-value.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Returns the angle that this Actor is facing (in degrees). Will always be in the interval [0, 360).
        Returns:
        The angle in degrees of this Actor.

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Returns the current color of this Actor (as an integer to be used in setColor()).
        Returns:
        An integer representing the current color of this Actor.

      • getColorInstance

        public java.awt.Color getColorInstance()
        Returns the current Color object of this Actor.
        Returns:
        A Color object representing the color that this Actor draws with.

      • getCanvas

        public Canvas getCanvas()
        Returns the Canvas.
        Returns:
        A Canvas object representing the canvas in which this Actor resides.

      • addToCanvas

        public void addToCanvas()
        Adds this Actor to the Canvas.

      • penUp

        public void penUp()
        Instructs this Actor to stop drawing.

      • penDown

        public void penDown()
        Instructs this Actor to start drawing.

      • turn

        public void turn​(double degrees)
        Instructs this Actor to rotate a specified number of degrees (clockwise).
        Parameters:
        degrees - The number of degrees this Actor rotates.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo​(double degrees)
        Sets the rotation of this Actor to a specified number of degrees.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The new rotation (in degrees) of this Actor.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo​(double newX,
                   double newY)
        Moves this Actor to a specified position. Will draw if penDown.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.
        newY - The new y-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.

      • move

        public void move​(double distance)
        Moves this Actor a specified number of units in the direction it is facing. Will draw if distance > 0.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance for this Actor to travel (in pixels).

      • setColor

        public void setColor​(java.lang.String col)
        Sets the color to the specified color. Allowed values are: - "black" - "red" - "blue" - "yellow" - "green" - "magenta" - any hex color, that is "#RRGGBB" Will change the color to Black if an invalid String is chosen.
        Parameters:
        col - A String representing the new color of this Actor.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        This method pauses the current thread for a short duration of time (100ms). This allows the user to see step-by-step how the turtle acts.

      • pause

        public void pause​(long milliseconds)
        This method pauses the current thread for a specified duration of time. This allows the user to see step-by-step how the turtle acts.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - The time, in milliseconds, to pause.

      • setColor

        public void setColor​(int i)
        Sets the color to c, 0 <= c < 6 0: black, 1: red, 2: blue, 3: yellow, 4: green, 5: magenta Will set the color to Black if an integer outside the interval [0, 5] is chosen.
        Parameters:
        i - The new color of this Actor.
